definition: abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
Mahathir bin Mohamad (1925-), Malaysian politician, prime minister 1981-2003 and 2018-

sentences.english: And his cursed soul was cast into the viles of Hades…
sentences.chinese: 他那被诅咒的灵魂坠入了哈迪斯的深渊。

sentences.english: Hadid herself created the immersive display for her objects.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪德为了她的物品创造了沉浸式虚拟现实显示。

sentences.english: Mr. Hardy was a grafter indeed.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪先生实际上是个贪污犯。

sentences.english: A thriving jihadi subculture has emerged.
sentences.chinese: 一个繁荣的杰哈迪亚文化出现了。

sentences.english: It’s Harvey Judd from Hale and Hearty here.
sentences.chinese: 我是“哈尔及哈迪食品公司”的哈维贾德。

sentences.english: Hadi from Senegal is a technical director of a factory.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪是来自塞内加尔的一家工厂的技术总监。

sentences.english: "International pressure is what causes change," Ahadi said.
sentences.chinese: “国际压力使是情况有所改变”，阿哈迪说。
“他是真正意义上的残暴，”哈迪说。

sentences.english: The water of Muad'Dib is here.
He is the brother of Zeus and Hades.
sentences.chinese: 他是宙斯和哈迪斯的兄弟。

sentences.english: It is, however, in America itself that Haditha may have its biggest and arguably most baneful impact.
sentences.chinese: 然而哈迪塞事件在美国或许有着最大的，最坏的影响。

sentences.english: "The fact is, the execution can still happen, " Ahadi said.
sentences.chinese: “事实是，执行仍然可以发生，”阿哈迪说。

sentences.english: According to legend her piano makes gloomy hades get happy smile.
sentences.chinese: 相传她的琴声能令阴沉的哈迪斯得到开心的笑容。

sentences.english: Palestinian analyst Mahdi Abdel Hadi is less optimistic.
sentences.chinese: 巴勒斯坦分析人士哈迪则没有这么乐观。
哈迪先生的解释很不充足。

sentences.english: Laurel and Harday were in double harness throughout most of their film careers.
sentences.chinese: 劳雷尔和哈迪在他们大部分的电影生涯中合作亲密。

definition: Maliki or Al-Maliki (name)/Nouri Kamel al-Maliki (1950-) prime minister of Iraq from 2006
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO)/abbr. for 巴勒斯坦解放組織|巴勒斯坦解放组织[Ba1 le4 si1 tan3 Jie3 fang4 Zu3 zhi1]
Sadr (name)/Moqtada Sadr (c. 1973-), Iraqi Shia clergyman and militia leader
